org.opensky.libadsb.msgs

Class ModeSReply

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensky.libadsb.msgs.ModeSReply
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AllCallReply, AltitudeReply, ExtendedSquitter, IdentifyReply

    public class ModeSReply
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Decoder for Mode S replies
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ModeSReply.subtype
      Indicator set by all specializations of this class to tell users which message format is encapsulated in this Mode S message.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte[] CRC_polynomial
      polynomial for the cyclic redundancy check
      Note: we assume that the degree of the polynomial is divisible by 8 (holds for Mode S) and the msb is left out

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModeSReply(java.lang.String raw_message)
      We assume the following message format:
      | DF (5) | FF (3) | Payload (24/80) | PI/AP (24) |

    • Method Summary

    • Field Detail

      • CRC_polynomial

        public static final byte[] CRC_polynomial
        polynomial for the cyclic redundancy check
        Note: we assume that the degree of the polynomial is divisible by 8 (holds for Mode S) and the msb is left out

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModeSReply

        public ModeSReply(java.lang.String raw_message)
           throws BadFormatException
        We assume the following message format:
        | DF (5) | FF (3) | Payload (24/80) | PI/AP (24) |
        Parameters:
        raw_message - Mode S message in hex representation
        Throws:
        BadFormatException - if message has invalid length or payload does not match specification or parity has invalid length

    • Method Detail

      • calcParity

        public static byte[] calcParity(byte[] msg)
        Returns:
        calculated parity field as 3-byte array. We used the implementation from
        http://www.eurocontrol.int/eec/gallery/content/public/document/eec/report/1994/022_CRC_calculations_for_Mode_S.pdf

      • getType

        public ModeSReply.subtype getType()
        Returns:
        the subtype

      • getDownlinkFormat

        public byte getDownlinkFormat()
        Returns:
        downlink format of the Mode S reply

      • getIcao24

        public byte[] getIcao24()
        Returns:
        the icao24 as an 3-byte array

      • getPayload

        public byte[] getPayload()
        Returns:
        payload as 3- or 10-byte array containing the Mode S reply without the first and the last three bytes.

      • getParity

        public byte[] getParity()
        Returns:
        parity field from message as 3-byte array

      • calcParity

        public byte[] calcParity()
        Returns:
        calculates Mode S parity as 3-byte array

      • checkParity

        public boolean checkParity()
        Returns:
        true if parity in message matched calculated parity

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
